    • Method Detail

      • getHardwareChannels

        public List<HodoscopeChannel> getHardwareChannels(int ix,
                                                  int iy,
                                                  int layer)
        Gets the hardware channels that correspond to a scintillator. Note that method updateScintillatorChannelMap(HodoscopeChannelCollection) must be run before this method will function.
        Parameters:
        ix - - The x-index of the scintillator. This should range from 0 (for the closest to the beam) to 4 (for the farthest from the beam).
        iy - - The y-index of the hodoscope. This may be either -1 for the bottom half of the hodoscope or 1 for the top half.
        layer - - The layer number of the hodoscope. This may be either 0 for layer 1 or 1 for layer 2.
        Returns:
        Returns the hardware channel(s) for the scintillator as a List of HodoscopeChannel objects. If the scintillator is invalid, then a value of null will be returned.

      • getHardwareChannels

        public List<HodoscopeChannel> getHardwareChannels(SimTrackerHit hit)
        Gets the hardware channels that correspond to the scintillator on which an argument hit occurs. Note that method updateScintillatorChannelMap(HodoscopeChannelCollection) must be run before this method will function.
        Parameters:
        hit - - The hit.
        Returns:
        Returns the hardware channel(s) for the scintillator as a List of HodoscopeChannel objects. If the scintillator is invalid, then a value of null will be returned.

      • getHodoscopeIndices

        public final int[] getHodoscopeIndices(IIdentifier id)
        Gets the x-, y-, and z-indices of the hodoscope scintillator on which the hit occurred.
        Parameters:
        id - - The hit's IIdentifier object.
        Returns:
        Returns the scintillator indices in the form of an int array with the format { ix, iy, iz }.

      • getHodoscopeIndices

        public final int[] getHodoscopeIndices(SimTrackerHit hit)
        Gets the x-, y-, and z-indices of the hodoscope scintillator on which the hit occurred.
        Parameters:
        hit - - The hit.
        Returns:
        Returns the scintillator indices in the form of an int array with the format { ix, iy, iz }.

      • getScintillatorChannelCount

        public int getScintillatorChannelCount(int ix,
                                       int iy,
                                       int layer)
        Gets the number of unique channels contained in the specified scintillator. Some scintillators will have two optical fiber holes which lead to separate channels. Others have either one optical fiber hole or two, but each connect to the same FADC channel.
        Parameters:
        ix - - The x-index of the scintillator. This should range from 0 (for the closest to the beam) to 4 (for the farthest from the beam).
        iy - - The y-index of the hodoscope. This may be either -1 for the bottom half of the hodoscope or 1 for the top half.
        layer - - The layer number of the hodoscope. This may be either 0 for layer 1 or 1 for layer 2.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of unique FADC channels as an int. This is 1 for scintillators that have either one fiber hole or both fiber holes connect to the same FADC channel. It is 2 otherwise.

      • getScintillatorChannelCount

        public int getScintillatorChannelCount(IIdentifier id)
        Gets the number of unique channels contained in the specified scintillator. Some scintillators will have two optical fiber holes which lead to separate channels. Others have either one optical fiber hole or two, but each connect to the same FADC channel.
        Parameters:
        id - - The IIdentifier object associated with the scintillator.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of unique FADC channels as an int. This is 1 for scintillators that have either one fiber hole or both fiber holes connect to the same FADC channel. It is 2 otherwise.

      • getScintillatorChannelCount

        public int getScintillatorChannelCount(SimTrackerHit hit)
        Gets the number of unique channels contained in the specified scintillator. Some scintillators will have two optical fiber holes which lead to separate channels. Others have either one optical fiber hole or two, but each connect to the same FADC channel.
        Parameters:
        hit - - A hit occurring on the scintillator.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of unique FADC channels as an int. This is 1 for scintillators that have either one fiber hole or both fiber holes connect to the same FADC channel. It is 2 otherwise.

      • getScintillatorHalfDimensions

        public final double[] getScintillatorHalfDimensions(IIdentifier id)
        Gets the dimensions of the scintillator on which the hit occurred. Returned values are one half the actual width, height, and depth of the scintillator.
        Parameters:
        id - - The hit's IIdentifier object.
        Returns:
        Returns a double array in the format of { width / 2, height / 2, depth / 2 }.

      • getScintillatorHalfDimensions

        public final double[] getScintillatorHalfDimensions(SimTrackerHit hit)
        Gets the dimensions of the scintillator on which the hit occurred. Returned values are one half the actual width, height, and depth of the scintillator.
        Parameters:
        hit - - The hit.
        Returns:
        Returns a double array in the format of { width / 2, height / 2, depth / 2 }.

      • getScintillatorHolePositions

        public final double[] getScintillatorHolePositions(IIdentifier id)
        Gets the absolute positioning of the optical fiber hole(s) in the scintillator in which a hit occurred. The array will be either size 1 for scintillators with only one fiber hole or size 2 for this with two. The first index corresponds to the fiber hole that is closest to the center of the detector, and the second to the one that is closer to the positron side of the detector.
        Parameters:
        id - - The hit's IIdentifier object.
        Returns:
        Returns a double array containing the absolute positions of the optical fiber holes in the scintillator.

      • getScintillatorHolePositions

        public final double[] getScintillatorHolePositions(SimTrackerHit hit)
        Gets the absolute positioning of the optical fiber hole(s) in the scintillator in which a hit occurred. The array will be either size 1 for scintillators with only one fiber hole or size 2 for this with two. The first index corresponds to the fiber hole that is closest to the center of the detector, and the second to the one that is closer to the positron side of the detector.
        Parameters:
        hit - - The hit.
        Returns:
        Returns a double array containing the absolute positions of the optical fiber holes in the scintillator.

      • getScintillatorIdentifier

        public final IIdentifier getScintillatorIdentifier(int key)
        Gets the IIdentifier object corresponding to the specified scintillator indices.
        Parameters:
        key - - The unique key corresponding to the scintillator. it may be acquired via the method getScintillatorUniqueKey(int, int, int).
        Returns:
        Returns the IIdentifier associated with the specified scintillator.

      • getScintillatorIdentifier

        public final IIdentifier getScintillatorIdentifier(int ix,
                                                   int iy,
                                                   int layer)
        Gets the IIdentifier object corresponding to the specified scintillator indices.
        Parameters:
        ix - - The x-index of the scintillator. This should range from 0 (for the closest to the beam) to 4 (for the farthest from the beam).
        iy - - The y-index of the hodoscope. This may be either -1 for the bottom half of the hodoscope or 1 for the top half.
        layer - - The layer number of the hodoscope. This may be either 0 for layer 1 or 1 for layer 2.
        Returns:
        Returns the IIdentifier associated with the specified scintillator.

      • getScintillatorIdentifiers

        public final List<IIdentifier> getScintillatorIdentifiers()
        Gets a list all the IIdentifier objects corresponding to the hodoscope scintillators.
        Returns:
        Returns the hodoscope scintillator ID objects in an unmodifiable List.

      • getScintillatorPosition

        public final double[] getScintillatorPosition(IIdentifier id)
        Gets the position of the center of the scintillator on which the hit occurred.
        Parameters:
        id - - The hit's IIdentifier object.
        Returns:
        Returns a double array in the format of { x, y, z }.

      • getScintillatorUniqueKey

        public static final int getScintillatorUniqueKey(int ix,
                                                 int iy,
                                                 int layer)
        Create a unique key for the hodoscope scintillator.
        Parameters:
        ix - - The x-index of the scintillator. This should range from 0 (for the closest to the beam) to 4 (for the farthest from the beam).
        iy - - The y-index of the hodoscope. This may be either -1 for the bottom half of the hodoscope or 1 for the top half.
        layer - - The layer number of the hodoscope. This may be either 0 for layer 1 or 1 for layer 2.
        Returns:
        Returns a unique integer representing these values. The last bit represents the layer, the penultimate bit the top or bottom position, and the remaining bits the x-index.

      • getScintillatorUniqueKey

        public final int getScintillatorUniqueKey(IIdentifier id)
        Create a unique key for the hodoscope scintillator.
        Parameters:
        id - - The IIdentifier object that corresponds to the scintillator.
        Returns:
        Returns a unique integer representing these values. The last bit represents the layer, the penultimate bit the top or bottom position, and the remaining bits the x-index.

      • getScintillatorUniqueKey

        public final int getScintillatorUniqueKey(SimTrackerHit hit)
        Create a unique key for the scintillator on which a hit occurs.
        Parameters:
        hit - - The hit.
        Returns:
        Returns a unique integer representing these values. The last bit represents the layer, the penultimate bit the top or bottom position, and the remaining bits the x-index.

        Returns:
